snippet: An exchange at the United Nations over what Argentina called militarization in the Falklands reflected deteriorating ties between the two nations.
abstract: Argentina lashes out at Great Britain in an increasingly tense territorial dispute over the Falkland Islands, accusing it of deploying a nuclear-armed submarine to the South Atlantic and threatening the region's stability.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and CHARLES NEWBERY
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Charles Newbery from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: An exchange at the United Nations over what Argentina called militarization in the Falklands reflected deteriorating ties between the two nations.

headline.seo: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions in Falklands
headline.main: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions
headline.print_headline: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions
